DOC.brief_summary: To determine whether treat transcutaneous electrical acupoint stimulation ( TEAS ) perioperative could alleviate postoperative gastrointestinal complication cesarean section combine spinal epidural anesthesia compare control non-acupoint group .
DOC.brief_title: Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation Gastrointestinal Function After Cesarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: Acupuncture traditional Chinese medical technique involve insertion needle acupoints treat diseases.Clinical evidence support efficacy acupuncture treatment many application . Some previous study report stimulation acupoint exert good effect digestive system.Compared acupuncture , transcutaneous electric acupoint stimulation ( TEAS ) non-invasive technique similar effect acupuncture.We hypothesize TEAS anesthesia surgery would decrease morbidity mortality postoperative complication 30 day Cesarean section .
DOC.criteria: 1 . ASA physical status 1or2 , schedule elective cesarean section combine spinal epidural anesthesia 2 . Gestational age ≥38 week 3 . Provide write informed consent 1 . ASA status≥Ⅲ 2 . Patients undergo surgery within 12 h admission hospital 3 . Patients fetal anomaly，medical obstetric complication Diabetes mellitus、Hypertension、Obesity ( BMW≥35 ) 4 . Patients suffer drug addiction impair mental state 5 . Patients history gastrointestinal surgery chronic gastrointestinal disease . 6 . Patients contraindication use electroacupuncture , skin damage infection acupoints 7 . Patients experience transcutaneous electrical stimulation treatment 8 . Participate clinical trial 3 month enrollment 9 . Not suitable participate experiment
